title: "The best american infographics 2013" cover and body font
content:

author: juanje

comments.content:
Was about to say [Liquorstore](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317172123/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/chank/liquorstore) but some details are off (/B, /M centre vertex...).  
Other alternative, playing with alternates, [Refrigerator Deluxe](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317172123/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/marksimonson/refrigerator-deluxe).

It's a font called **Kraftwerk** by Charles R. Anderson (1995, CAKE Publications)  
More info on Charles R. Anderson (or "Chank") by L.Devroye:  
 [http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-27502.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317172123/http:/luc.devroye.org/fonts-27502.html "http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-27502.html")
Good catch as usual, Fivos! Good to read I was not so far with Liquorstore as it has been designed by the same designer as Kraftwerk (probably its prequel).
Wow, yes, thanks guys. I thought Liquorstore too. What about the body font that I attached?

The body font must be **[Absara Light / Italic](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317172123/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=FontShop&ffam=Absara%20Light%20-%20Italic&fid=6bfd3c473c9da04fde06c0400f09fe5f&fsize=60&text=America's%20Most%20Popular%20Birthdays&wrap=2)** by Xavier Dupre (FontShop, 2004)
Awesome, fast and right, thanks a lot! :)
